author: rjected
content:
For removing block downloads from `eth` and moving to separate subprotocol:
I don't understand what this improves practically, or why it would be necessary.

w.r.t. version bump for 4444: the eip does not seem like a p2p protocol change. My reasoning is that it is just loosening restrictions on what nodes serve. Currently these restrictions are enforced by each node's peer scoring, so to me the EIP is essentially just a recommendation for how to implement scoring rules and bodies download logic. In a pre-4444 world, if peers do not have a block, we still have to _eventually_ churn peers to find a peer that does have it. Non-upgraded nodes would do this in a post-4444 world as well. Given the SHOULD NOT language, 4444 seems backwards compatible to me.

The bigger question is whether or not remaining on an existing version while nodes drop history, will lead to a healthy network post transition (the asymmetric upgrades question afaict). It looks like this will just increase the churn rate for nodes that are not upgraded / are still attempting to download blocks from genesis

lmk if this makes sense

author: rjected
content:
> why I am still in favor of bumping the protocol version is that it serves as a forcing function for moving 4444s forward
I don't agree with this, I think the best approach for moving 4444s forward is keeping us (EL client teams) all accountable in:
1. being ready to drop in a reasonable timeframe, and
2. getting the pre-merge history drop in client releases

Given that I currently don't think the bump is necessary, the version bump just seems like extra work on top of the above

author: rjected
content: I am strongly in favor of the existing eth/69 changes (removing td, bloom from receipts), but feel that this work can be done on its own timeframe and review / feedback loop independent of 4444 work.

author: pipermerriam
content: I think we have broad agreement that we SHOULD NOT bump the version of the eth protocol. I think this finalizes everything that needed agreement for 4444s. Mark your calendars for May 1st 2025!
